content:
• Friday, November 16, 2012
  • GNOM

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: GNOM +12.5%. GTAT +5.1%. SWFT +4.6%. KFY +4.5%. STRI...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: GNOM +12.5%. GTAT +5.1%. SWFT +4.6%. KFY +4.5%. STRI +4.5%. 
    After-hours top losers: KWK -10.4%. REGN -9.7%. BPZ -9.4%. FLO -9.2%. NSM -8.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • LONG

    eLong's (LONG -2.2%) Q3 results suggest Ctrip (CTRP -5%) is losing share in the Chinese online...

    eLong's (LONG -2.2%) Q3 results suggest Ctrip (CTRP -5%) is losing share in the Chinese online travel market, thinks Citi. While eLong posted 24% Y/Y revenue growth and 70% hotel bookings growth, Ctrip respectively posted growth rates of 40% and 11%. Ctrip rallied last week after beating Q3 estimates and providing decent Q4 guidance; shares have bounced over the last 3 months of the year after falling hard over the first 7.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY -9.8%) founder Richard Schulze is still working on a buyout offer for the...

    Best Buy (BBY -9.8%) founder Richard Schulze is still working on a buyout offer for the electronics chain, a source tells Bloomberg. Shares fell to 10-year lows today, apparently on speculation Schulze's offer might not pan out. Reuters reported last week Schulze might end up bidding at a price below the $24-$26/share range he previously suggested. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • CYNO

    Cynosure (CYNO +6.6%) finished the day higher after pricing its 2.6M share public offering at...

    Cynosure (CYNO +6.6%) finished the day higher after pricing its 2.6M share public offering at $20.59 per share, a 3.3% discount to Thursday's close. The company says El.En S.p.A. sold 600Kshares in the offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • BSPM

    Biostar Pharmaceuticals (OTC:BSPM +5%) rallies today ahead of its Q3 results due out Monday just...

    Biostar Pharmaceuticals (OTC:BSPM +5%) rallies today ahead of its Q3 results due out Monday just before the market open. In August the company announced that it expects Q3 sales to significantly improve as compared to Q2 2012 earnings of $8.16M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • TRP

    A high-profile group of nine Democratic and nine Republican senators urges Pres. Obama to...

    A high-profile group of nine Democratic and nine Republican senators urges Pres. Obama to quickly issue a permit for the northern leg of the Keystone pipeline (TRP +1.8%), citing the need to create jobs and to reduce oil imports from the Middle East. The senators' letter comes just ahead of a protest against the pipeline planned for the White House on Sunday.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 8 Comments
  • AMRN

    Shares of Amarin (AMRN -4.4%) spike lower after the FDA's latest Orange Book update shows no...

    Shares of Amarin (AMRN -4.4%) spike lower after the FDA's latest Orange Book update shows no change in the status of its fish-oil pill Vascepa. M&A speculators had been optimistic on a decision from regulators over the exclusivity of the pill would be coming this month, because last week a draft response letter made the rounds around the FDA which made no mention of 'no decision' this month, as it has previously before.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 5 Comments
  • CQP

    Cheniere Energy Partners (CQP +4.6%) is upgraded to Overweight by Barclays, which believes its...

    Cheniere Energy Partners (CQP +4.6%) is upgraded to Overweight by Barclays, which believes its license to export gas to both free trade and non-free trade countries will continue to enjoy "meaningful scarcity value." Although 14 other projects have applied for a similar license, the firm thinks new licenses are unlikely to be anywhere close to demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 5 Comments
  • FACE

    Physicians Formula (FACE +2.1%) and Markwins International agree to amend their merger plan,...

    Physicians Formula (FACE +2.1%) and Markwins International agree to amend their merger plan, under which Markwins is acquiring FACE. Under the terms of the amended agreement, Markwins agreed to waive certain conditions to closing that would have been required to be satisfied. Markwins also agreed to increase the amount of the termination fee that it will be required to pay if the merger doesn't close by December 13, 2012 from $3.5M to $4.5M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • HSC

    Harsco (HSC +0.7%) says that its CFO and treasurer, Stephen J. Schnoor, has resigned, effective...

    Harsco (HSC +0.7%) says that its CFO and treasurer, Stephen J. Schnoor, has resigned, effective today. The company has appointed its current corporate controller, Barry E. Malamud, as interim CFO while it searches for a permanent replacement.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • NTES

    Sohu (SOHU -4.8%) is selling off again today, likely on account of fellow Chinese portal owner...

    Sohu (SOHU -4.8%) is selling off again today, likely on account of fellow Chinese portal owner Sina's disappointing Q4 guidance. Shares fell on Wednesday after HSBC started coverage with an Underweight, and (like Baidu and Sina's shares) aren't far removed from their 52-week low. NetEase (NTES -5.5%), which dived yesterday in response to its Q3 miss, is also having a bad day.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • FTR

    Frontier (FTR -2%) is slumping after receiving a downgrade to Sell from Goldman, which argues...

    Frontier (FTR -2%) is slumping after receiving a downgrade to Sell from Goldman, which argues the carrier's cost structure is deteriorating thanks to a mix shift to lower-margin services. Like other wireline telcos, Frontier has to maintain a giant local-loop infrastructure even as the revenue it generates steadily declines due to mobile and VoIP activity. Windstream (WIN +0.2%) has also been downgraded to Sell - Goldman cites margin pressure - but is up slightly.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • CYBX

    Cyberonics (CYBX +11%) gets a big boost today from a solid FQ2 earnings beat. Net fiscal...

    Cyberonics (CYBX +11%) gets a big boost today from a solid FQ2 earnings beat. Net fiscal earnings rose 50%, thanks in part to a warrant-liability gain. The company also raised its full-year earnings estimate, now expecting to earn between $1.56 and $1.62 per share, above its June forecast of $1.49 to $1.59, and increased its sales guidance by $5 million, now expecting around $246M to $249M in sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials (AMAT -1%) now expects the chip equipment industry to contract by 5%-15% in...

    Applied Materials (AMAT -1%) now expects the chip equipment industry to contract by 5%-15% in 2013, a forecast easily worse than a recent Gartner estimate for a 0.8% increase. Applied, which offered soft FQ1 guidance yesterday to go with its FQ4 beat, mentioned on its earnings call it expects chip wafer starts and utilization rates to drop again in FQ1. Its outlook for solar equipment demand is predictably bleak, though the company is a little more optimistic about a rebound in LCD equipment orders.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • ATVI

    Activision (ATVI +4.8%) registers a big gain after announcing it sold over $500M worth of copies...

    Activision (ATVI +4.8%) registers a big gain after announcing it sold over $500M worth of copies of Call of Duty: Black Ops II in its first 24 hours of availability. GameStop (GME +2.9%), which reported strong initial sales for the game earlier this week, is also rallying. The solid early reception for Black Ops II and Microsoft's Halo 4 are fueling hopes the console game industry will cap what has been an ugly year with a decent holiday season.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • JASO

    In an attempt to prevent a NASDAQ de-listing, JA Solar (JASO -10.7%) is enacting a 1-to-5...

    In an attempt to prevent a NASDAQ de-listing, JA Solar (JASO -10.7%) is enacting a 1-to-5 reverse split for its ADS' that will take place on Dec. 10. The move hasn't stopped shares from diving to $0.62 today as part of another general rout in solar stocks. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • AAPL

    When Apple (AAPL -2.2%) last traded at its current level of $514, MLB spring training hadn't...

    When Apple (AAPL -2.2%) last traded at its current level of $514, MLB spring training hadn't started and the 3rd-gen iPad was still a mystery. Outside of the poor sales figures for Dell's PC business, which Mac/iPad sales are partly responsible for, there doesn't seem to be any major news to trigger today's sharp decline. Shares now trade at just a little over 7x FY13E EPS exc. cash - the Street seems to be pricing in expectations of limited growth and ongoing margin pressure.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 48 Comments
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA -15.2%) is near its 52-week low as investors register disappointment with the Q4...

    Sina (SINA -15.2%) is near its 52-week low as investors register disappointment with the Q4 guidance accompanying its Q3 beat. Downgrading shares to Sell, Citi expresses concerns about Sina's slumping mobile portal business and suggests it's time to start valuing the company on a P/E basis, something many haven't done on account of Weibo spending, which led R&D expenses to rise 46% Y/Y in Q3. Weibo registered users rose 15% Q/Q to 424M, though only 10% were daily active users. 72% of DAUs at least partly accessed via mobile. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • PEIX

    Shares of Pacific Ethanol (PEIX +11.4%), BioFuel (BIOF +4.1%) and Archer Daniels Midland (ADM...

    Shares of Pacific Ethanol (PEIX +11.4%), BioFuel (BIOF +4.1%) and Archer Daniels Midland (ADM +0.8%) pop higher on word the EPA has rejected waiver requests for ethanol use in gasoline. On the downside watch list are Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE -5.1%), Westport (WPRT -2.6%) and others planning to convert engines to natural gas.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +7.7%) is rallying again in the wake of Wednesday's lockup expiration. Today's move...

    Facebook (FB +7.7%) is rallying again in the wake of Wednesday's lockup expiration. Today's move comes as Facebook rolls out a tool that allows online retailers and travel sites to figure out who made a purchase after viewing a Facebook ad, part of a broader effort to provide ad solutions covering both Facebook and non-Facebook activity. Also, Facebook just added a slew of new partners for its Gifts e-commerce solution. An informal poll from The Verge suggests only a small fraction of Facebook users have thus far used Gifts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 6 Comments
  • OMX

    OfficeMax (OMX +22.5%) shoots higher after its $175M investment in Boise Cascade looks prepared...

    OfficeMax (OMX +22.5%) shoots higher after its $175M investment in Boise Cascade looks prepared to take off it with the paper company filing a plan with the SEC (S-1) to raise up to $200M in an IPO. Shares of OMX are swimming around above the $10 mark for the first time in over a year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • SNY

    Sanofi (SNY -0.6%) and Regeneron (REGN +7.8%) report that the European Medicines Agency's CHMP...

    Sanofi (SNY -0.6%) and Regeneron (REGN +7.8%) report that the European Medicines Agency's CHMP has recommended granting marketing authorization for Zaltrap Injection for Intravenous Infusion in combination with FOLFIRI chemotherapy in adults with metastatic colorectal cancer. All that remains is for the European Commission to ratify the positive opinion from the CHMP to grant marketing authorization in all 27 E.U. member countries. A decision is expected in Q113.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • DELL-OLD

    Down just a bit premarket, Dell (DELL-OLD -6.4%) has plunged to levels last seen during the...

    Down just a bit premarket, Dell (DELL-OLD -6.4%) has plunged to levels last seen during the financial crisis as the Street digests the ugly PC sales data in its FQ3 report. Aside from the PC industry's problems, many are concerned over whether Dell's PC ops simply aren't cost-competitive with those of Lenovo and other Asian rivals, and whether their declining scale will make them even less so. Will the company heed calls for a major strategy change? HPQ -3.1%. (Gale Technologies) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 2 Comments
  • YGE

    The solar industry's bad earnings news won't let up. Yingli (YGE -8.3%) is the latest culprit,...

    The solar industry's bad earnings news won't let up. Yingli (YGE -8.3%) is the latest culprit, warning it expects to report a 17% Q/Q drop for Q3 module shipments on Nov. 28, something that doubtlessly means Yingli's prior guidance for a 31%-37% Y/Y increase in 2012 shipments won't hold. Gross margin is expected to total just 0%-1% if one doesn't include the reversal of a provision related to the ITC's anti-dumping duties, and -22% to -24% if one does. Solar stocks are selling off again (TAN -3%), capping off a brutal week. (Canadian Solar)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • RKUS

    Ruckus Wireless (NYSE:RKUS) has turned in a disappointing IPO. After pricing its 8.4M-share...

    Ruckus Wireless (NYSE:RKUS) has turned in a disappointing IPO. After pricing its 8.4M-share offering at $15, the high end of its range, shares opened exactly at $15 and have since slipped to $14.30, down 5%. That gives it a valuation of $1.06B. Ruckus' steep multiples could be giving investors pause, offsetting any enthusiasm regarding the carrier Wi-Fi equipment firm's strong growth rate. Ruckus had revenue of $152.5M (+93% Y/Y) over the first 9 months of 2012, and net income of $7.4M. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD -13.4%) fall hard after the retailer's Q3 report doesn't give...

    Shares of Sears Holdings (SHLD -13.4%) fall hard after the retailer's Q3 report doesn't give forward-looking investors much to latch onto. Author Lawrence McDonald's take on Sears summarizes the general vibe of traders: "Thank god for that real estate. That makes 23 straight quarters of negative sales growth at Sears Holdings."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 19 Comments
  • DDC

    Harry Winston Diamond (HWD -2%) shareholders may want to keep an eye open for fireworks ahead,...

    Harry Winston Diamond (HWD -2%) shareholders may want to keep an eye open for fireworks ahead, as self-proclaimed activist hedge fund Starboard Value stated in a filing that it owned 1.3M HWD shares as of Sept. 30, or ~1.5% of the company. Starboard has engaged in 45 proxy fights since 1999, but has kept silent so far on its HWD stake.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • MRVL

    Marvell (MRVL -0.7%) can't catch a break. Shares were up strongly AH yesterday after the...

    Marvell (MRVL -0.7%) can't catch a break. Shares were up strongly AH yesterday after the chipmaker beat FQ3 revenue estimates, but are down slightly after it used its earnings call to guide for FQ4 revenue of $700M-$740M and EPS of $0.11-$0.15, below a consensus of $747.2M and $0.17. Management claimed it's going through a "product transition" in its share-losing mobile baseband chip business, and predicted new chips supporting both TD-SCDMA and W-CDMA 3G networks would provide a lift. (FQ3 warning)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • SWSH

    Swisher Hygiene (SWSH +48.7%) pops nearly 50% at the open after Progressive Waste Solutions (BIN...

    Swisher Hygiene (SWSH +48.7%) pops nearly 50% at the open after Progressive Waste Solutions (BIN -0.5%) acquires Choice Environmental Services from SWSH for $123M, giving Progressive greater exposure to the Florida market.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • ASCA

    Other winners from the casino sector moving off the news Penn National Gaming will split off its...

    Other winners from the casino sector moving off the news Penn National Gaming will split off its real estate assets into a REIT include Ameristar Casinos (ASCA +17.5%), Melco Crown (MPEL +4%), and Wynn Resorts (WYNN +2.9%). Though the fuse for the rally was lit by Penn's announcement, Las Vegas Sands CEO Sheldon Adelson tipped off a split of gaming and real estate assets could be part of the strategic game plan in the sector during the firm's Q3 earnings call earlier this month (transcript).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • CLDX

    Celldex Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CLDX) +6.1% premarket after announcing positive three-year survival...

    Celldex Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CLDX) +6.1% premarket after announcing positive three-year survival data for its rindopepimut Phase 2 clinical program. Data suggests "a substantial and continuing survival benefit in comparison to independent control datasets," and strongly supports an ongoing Phase 3 clinical program, CLDX says.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • PENN

    Premarket gainers: PENN +33%. SHF +29%. SWSH +22%. OMX +17%. ASCA +17%. CLNT +15%. BYD +12%....

    Premarket gainers: PENN +33%. SHF +29%. SWSH +22%. OMX +17%. ASCA +17%. CLNT +15%. BYD +12%. STSI +11%. MGM +7%. OSIS +6%. LVS +6%. VRNG +6%. GMCR +5%. OTC:CALI +5%. FRO +5%.
    Losers: DVAX -48%. SINA -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • GMCR

    Analysts at Dougherty upgrade Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) to Buy from Neutral...

    Analysts at Dougherty upgrade Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) to Buy from Neutral on their view demand is impressive and competition is slowing. After the coffee concern's last couple of quarterly reports have been adventuresome to say the least, the firm expects a strong FQ4. GMCR +4.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM | 2 Comments
  • PENN

    Casino stocks hit blackjack: Penn National Gaming (NASDAQ:PENN) continues to roar higher after...

    Casino stocks hit blackjack: Penn National Gaming (NASDAQ:PENN) continues to roar higher after the company decides to spin off its real estate assets, now up 38.1% premarket. The entire gaming sector is on watch with the casino REIT play now firmly part of the discussion. The Market Vectors Gaming ETF (NYSEARCA:BJK) is teed up for a big gain today, while movers premarket include Las Vegas (NYSE:LVS) +5.8%, MGM Resorts (NYSE:MGM) +6.6%, Boyd Gaming +10.4%, and Pinnacle Entertainment +9.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM | 2 Comments
  • OSIS

    OSI Systems (NASDAQ:OSIS) shares begin to recover from yesterday's 28% plunge following a...

    OSI Systems (NASDAQ:OSIS) shares begin to recover from yesterday's 28% plunge following a report the maker of specialized electronics systems and components falsified information for its Rapiscan system. OSIS issued a denial, and Oppenheimer upgrades the stock and views the controversy as a "tempest in a teapot." OSIS +6.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC) says Papua New Guinea's national executive council approved the company's...

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC) says Papua New Guinea's national executive council approved the company's liquefied natural gas development project in the country, clearing the way to proceed with plans for an LNG plant in the Gulf Province with initial output of at least 3.8M metric tons/year. IOC +4.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 3 Comments
  • FL

    Retail done right? Hedgeye's Brian McGough notes Foot Locker's (NYSE:FL) most recent quarterly...

    Retail done right? Hedgeye's Brian McGough notes Foot Locker's (NYSE:FL) most recent quarterly report (I, II) added to its 3-year string of showing positive margins and sales growth that outpaced inventories. FL +5.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • STP

    Suntech (NYSE:STP) -6.2% premarket after cutting two of its three production shifts and ~50 jobs...

    Suntech (NYSE:STP) -6.2% premarket after cutting two of its three production shifts and ~50 jobs at its solar panel plant in Goodyear, Arizona. The world's top maker of solar panels is restructuring its operations worldwide in a bid to slash expenses by 20% in 2012 and 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • GERN

    Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) +7.4% premarket after agreeing to sell its shuttered embryonic stem cell...

    Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) +7.4% premarket after agreeing to sell its shuttered embryonic stem cell assets to BioTime (NYSEMKT:BTX), according to a non-binding letter of intent. The deal comes a year after GERN shut down the world's first trial of embryonic stem cells in humans. BTX says it arranged for a $10M investment from an undisclosed private investor to finance the proposed deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • NLY

    Annaly (NYSE:NLY) is upgraded to Outperform at Wells Fargo, which says the now-universal...

    Annaly (NYSE:NLY) is upgraded to Outperform at Wells Fargo, which says the now-universal knowledge of the problems facing the mREIT sector has created a buying opportunity "not seen since the height of the financial crisis." Shares +1.5% premarket. Earlier: Wells upgrades Hatteras.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:55 AM | 19 Comments
